item.title: Rise of the (carjacking) Superpredator
item.description: ## Warning: Removed 5822 rows containing non-finite values (stat_count). Carjackings make up a fairly high share of all robberies, at least higher than I expected. In 2019 there were 92,865 robberies reported among agencies that reported data in both 2019 and 2020. Of those, 7,349 had a motor vehicle stolen which means they were carjackings. Thatâ€™s about 7.9% of robberies being carjackings. In 2020 the number of robberies remained nearly the same at 92,230 while those with a vehicle stolen from the robbery (i.
